page.title: 06TOURISM
page.content: Knighton,although it has farms, factories,shops and hotels to employ local people it is also a very important tourist town.Visitors in buses,cars and some by train visit Knighton during the summer months.The majority of visitors are walkers, hikers and cyclists.The great attraction of Knighton is that it is the only town actually situated on{ {Offa's Dyke.}Many walkers walk the Dyke from Prestatyn in the north to Chepstow in the south.Knighton is the half way point and it has a very good {Offa's Dyke Heritage Centre}which houses maps,photographs and exhibitions of the Dyke.It also has a very good{Tourist Office.}Next to the Centre a {Youth Hostel }has been opened in the old Primary School and this caters for the overnight stops of walkers and cyclists.
